headline: Cincinnati's streetcar sets monthly ridership record
author: WLWT Digital Staff
sentences: Thomas said nationwide, transit ridership is down about 40% compared to the pre-pandemic numbers, however, the Cincinnati streetcar is seeing success after making fares free in fall 2020.
Brad Thomas tweeted Wednesday that the Cincinnati Bell Connector has broken its monthly ridership record for the fourth month in a row.
According to Thomas, February 2022 ridership was higher than February ridership of 2020 and 2021 combined with 49,651 riders.

CINCINNATI â€”
Cincinnati's streetcar system has set a monthly ridership record, according to a former SORTA board member.
February 2021 had 21,046 riders and February 2020 had 26,437 riders, according to data from the city of Cincinnati.
The month with the most riders in 2021 was September with 62,136 riders.
January 2022 had 43,131 riders and December 2021 had 55,105 riders.
